results.title: Live teddy bears: the koala
results.brief_description: Illustrates the characteristics and habits of the koala, both in a sanctuary and in its native habitat and explains the adaptation of the koala to its environment.

results.title: Live nude girls
results.creator_credit: Julianna Lavin, Barry Bernardi, Steve White, Steve White Properties and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Georgina, an attractive thirty-something, decides to hold a slumber party to celebrate the impending nuptials of her friend Jamie, a vain, B-grade actress getting married for the third time. Gathered together are several of their closest friends, all of whom have known each other since childhood. Questions of aging, parenthood, infidelity, low-self esteem, body image, bad partner choices, regrets, sexual orientation, defining childhood events, masturbation and squandered desires are workshopped over the course of the slumber party. All of the women assembled there are at transitional stages in their life, questioning the choices they have made: Georgina doubts her relationship with her female live-in lover, the perennially depressed Chris; Marcy is attempting to shake off a former lover who has taken to stalking her; Jill is pregnant with her second child. The many verbal exchanges reveal the petty jealousies that exist within the group, especially the rivalry between the straight-laced Rachel and her wilder and less inhibited sister, Jill. The friends discuss sex at great length, disclosing their fantasies, inhibitions, desires and sexual history. “Live nude girls” is a comedy that explores the territory of female sexuality, explicitly displaying the women’s numerous erotic fantasises and sexual experiences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julianna Lavin, Barry Bernardi, Steve White, Steve White Properties and Republic Pictures Corporation

results.title: Live forever
results.creator_credit: John Dower, John Battsek, Passion Pictures, Horsebridge Productions, Film Council and BBC
results.brief_description: Anecdotally hilarious documentary about the rise and fall of Brit-Pop in the 1990s and all it encompassed as a cultural phenomenon. This work assesses the mood of the times, or “Cool Britannia” as it was known, and the reasons why it was, for a while, great to be British; also addresses the role that Tony Blair and New Labor played, throwing off the drudgery of Thatcherism, embracing all that was new and youthful; and the band war between Oasis and Blur, played out on the pages on NME. Consisting almost entirely of interviews, the filmmakers have enhanced classic raw material with jazzy and judicious editing. From the insightful to the ridiculous, this is far from an exhaustive piece, but it provides an astute and witty snapshot of the times.

results.title: Live flesh = Carne tremula
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Agustin Almodovar, France 3, CiBy 2000 and El Deseo S. A.
results.brief_description: Several lives are forever altered by a single gun shot. Wealthy heiress and drug addict Helena (Francesca Neri), is awaiting her drug dealer when she accidentally allows in her apartment Victor (Liberto Rabal), to whom she vaguely promised a date. In the confusion that ensues, two cops, David (Javier Bardem) and Sancho (Jose Sancho) arrive and a gun goes off. Four years later, Victor comes out of jail and goes looking for Helena who is now married to paraplegic David and runs a children’s shelter. Victor’s desire for vengeance is temporarily sidetracked when he meets Clara (Angela Molina), an attractive, unhappily married older woman, keen to assist Victor in his other ultimate goal in life - to become the world’s best lover! Departing from his usual camp style Almodovar’s foray into film noir weaves a web of guilty pleasures, unbridled passions and not-so-sweet revenge mixed with subtle references to Bunuel. Adapted from “Live Flesh” by Ruth Rendell. In Spanish with English sub-titles.

results.title: Live and let live
results.creator_credit: Peter Ward, Cyril Randell and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Lack of proper care during the handling of cargo is the cause of frequent accidents on the docks. Safety regulations, safe equipment, and marked safe working loads help, but safe working men are the most important. Stresses teamwork, building proper stacks, and breaking them down correctly, using mechanical equipment with care and realising the risks involved around the hold where uneven footing leads to falls and foot injuries.

results.title: Live a life
results.creator_credit: Maxim Ford, Sally Hibbin and Parallax Pictures
results.brief_description: A concert for the unemployed was staged at the Rainbow with a line-up that included Tom Robinson, the Beat, Black Slate, OK Jive and Alexei Sayle. This film is a record of that concert and of the situation which prompted it. Discussions with the young unemployed are set against the rhetoric of the Thatcher regime.

results.title: Liu awaiting spring
results.creator_credit: Andrew Soo, Nadine Umback, Over Exposed Productions and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: Set against traditional Chinese music and imagery such as calligraphy and performance art a young gay Chinese man faces the dilemma of “coming out” to his family. His dilemma is complicated by the fact that one of their relatives has died from AIDS.

results.title: Little women (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss follows. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Little Women
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Denise Di Novi and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A glowing depiction of the true nature of family, the search for self and feminine independence based on the classic novel by Louisa May Alcott. Gillian Armstrong’s compelling film captures the romantic dramas and adventures of Mrs March and her four “little women”.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Gillian Armstrong, Denise Di Novi and Columbia Pictures
results.description: A glowing depiction of the true nature of family, the search for self and feminine independence based on the classic novel by Louisa May Alcott. Gillian Armstrong’s compelling film captures the romantic dramas and adventures of Mrs March (Susan Sarandon) and her four “little women”: spirited Jo (Winona Ryder), beautiful Meg (Trini Alvarado), fragile Beth (Claire Danes) and romantic Amy (Kirsten Dunst).

results.title: Little Women
results.brief_description: One of the most enduring of the Hollywood movie classics, “Little Women” is based on Louisa May Alcott’s beloved novel. It is the story of four sisters who grow up together in Massachusetts during the Civil War. We enter their world to share their joys and sorrows as they become the “little women” that their father so proudly calls them. Stars Katherine Hepburn, Douglas Montgomery, Paul Lukas, Joan Bennett, Frances Dee and Jean Parker.
